snippet: The first penalties under random inspections started last summer after a train carrying crude oil exploded in Quebec, killing 47.
abstract: Federal regulators fine Hess Corporation, Whiting Oil and Gas Corporation and Marathon Oil Corporation for mislabeling type of crude oil they were transporting; penalties, which total of $93,000, are first from surprise inspections begun after series of accidents in 2013 underscored the hazard of transporting highly flammable oil by rail.
lead_paragraph: The first penalties under random inspections started last summer after a train carrying crude oil exploded in Quebec, killing 47.

headline.main: 3 Companies Fined for Mislabeling Crude Oil in Rail Transit
headline.print_headline: 3 Companies Fined for Mislabeling Crude Oil in Rail Transit
